verses.roman:
bhagavān bhīṣmaka-sutām
evaṁ nirjitya bhūmi-pān
puram ānīya vidhi-vad
upayeme kurūdvaha

synonyms: bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; bhīṣmaka-sutām—the daughter of Bhīṣmaka; evam—thus; nirjitya—defeating; bhūmi-pān—the kings; puram—to His capital; ānīya—bringing; vidhi-vat—in accordance with the injunctions of the Vedas; upayeme—married; kuru-udvaha—O protector of the Kurus.
translation: Thus defeating all the opposing kings, the Supreme Personality of Godhead brought the daughter of Bhīṣmaka to His capital and married her according to the Vedic injunctions, O protector of the Kurus.
